title: Nikki Haley
deleted: Following her resignation from the United Nations Ambassadorship, Haley has been widely seen to run for higher office once again During the 2020 General Election, media outlets speculated that President Donald Trump would replace Vice President Mike Pence on the ticket with Haley.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Lejeune|first=Tristan|date=2020-03-13|title=Meghan McCain: Trump will replace Pence with Haley to counter 'identity politics'|url=https://thehill.com/homenews/media/487516-meghan-mccain-trump-will-replace-pence-with-haley-to-counter-identity-politics|access-date=2021-01-14|website=TheHill|language=en}}</ref> However, President Trump had committed to keeping Pence on the ticket early in his first term and the idea was widely rejected by Conservative Media outlets.<ref>{{Citation|title=President Trump probably won't replace Pence with Haley - CNN Video|url=https://www.cnn.com/videos/politics/2020/03/19/donald-trumps-2020-vice-president-mike-pence-nikki-haley-cillizza-the-point.cnn|access-date=2021-01-14}}</ref>

Haley has been favored to be a potential front-runner for the [[2024 Republican Party presidential primaries|2024 Republican Nomination for President of the United States]].<ref>{{Cite web|last=ashain@postandcourier.com|first=Andy Shain|title=Nikki Haley starts PAC as her expected 2024 White House bid takes shape|url=https://www.postandcourier.com/columbia/nikki-haley-starts-pac-as-her-expected-2024-white-house-bid-takes-shape/article_78e3ab50-55f1-11eb-9421-3f3b7a293f1f.html|access-date=2021-01-14|website=Post and Courier|language=en}}</ref> Following the 2020 Presidential Election and the certification of Joe Biden, she launched the Stand for America PAC, focusing on the 2022 midterms to regain Republican control of the House and Senate.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Markay|first=Lachlan|title=Nikki Haley's new political action committee steers clear of Trump brand|url=https://www.axios.com/nikki-haley-pac-avoids-trump-brand-ff6ed150-17bf-4eab-8e54-968f9c1650f1.html|access-date=2021-01-14|website=Axios|language=en}}</ref>

title: Nikki Haley
added: During the next years, "after being plucked from the governorship of South Carolina to serve as U.S. ambassador to the United Nations, Haley had navigated the Trump era with a singular shrewdness," Tim Alberta argues, citing a New York Times editorial claiming that Haley was able to "exit the administration with her dignity largely intact.‚Äù<ref>https://www.politico.com/interactives/2021/magazine-nikki-haleys-choice/</ref>
